resources.string: Example 2 Answer

INSTRUCTIONS

 • You will now see six more questions like the ones you just did.
 • Please enter the number that belongs in each empty space.
 • The numbers might increase, like 2, 4, 6, or decrease, like 6, 4, 2.
 • You may be asked a question with more than one empty space in the sequence.
 • Some of the questions may be easy but others may be hard. Just do the best you can.

 If you are ready to begin, please press "Next" to continue.
Undo
Please press \"Next\" to continue.
Abstract Reasoning
INSTRUCTIONS\n\nEach item in this task consists of a set of figures arranged in a pattern formed according to certain rules. Look at the pattern in the example.

The question mark (?) in the lower right corner of the box shows where a figure is missing in the pattern. Choose which of the five figures (A, B, C, D or E) under the pattern belongs where the \"?\" is.\n\nThen press \"Next\" to continue.

In the case of the example, the correct answer is E. Going from left to right, the figures are the same size, but the figure on the right has been turned upside down. Going from top to bottom, the figures get larger in size. Following these rules, the figure that goes at the \"?\" should be larger than the one above it, and exactly the same size as the one to the left of it, but upside down. Therefore, E is the correct answer.\n\nPlease press \"Next\" to continue.

In each question, you are to decide what figure belongs where the \"?\" is in the pattern. To do this you have to figure out how the figures change going from row to row, and how the figures change going from column to column. The items have different kinds of patterns and different rules by which the figures change.\n\nPlease press \"Next\" to continue.
Would you like to see another example, or are you ready to start this task?
Another example
Start task

Here is another example. Going from left to right, the circles get larger, and going from top to bottom they get darker. Therefore the answer has to be a circle which is the largest of the three sizes, and the darkest. Choices C and E are both the right size, but E is the only large circle with the correct shading. Thus E is the only figure that fits in the pattern formed by the other circles. E is the answer that should be chosen.\n\nPlease press \"Next\" to continue.
Now look at another example, which is quite different from either of the previous ones.\n\nChoose the figure that belongs at the \"?\" below, then press \"Next\" to continue.

If you study the pattern you will see that going from left to right there is one more line in each figure than in the one to the left of it. Going from top to bottom, the number of lines in any figure is one less than in the figure just above it. Therefore, the missing figure should have three lines. The correct answer is choice C (the three lines, slanting in the proper direction).\n\nPlease press \"Next\" to continue.

INSTRUCTIONS


You will now be asked six more questions like the ones you just did.

For each question, decide what rules the pattern follows. Choose the answer that belongs at the "?" by pressing the answer.

Many of the patterns are based on rules that are different from the ones in the sample items.

 When you are ready to begin, please press "Next".
Start Now
INSTRUCTIONS
Choose which figure belongs at the \"?\" by pressing the correct figure. Then press \"Next\" to continue.

INSTRUCTIONS\n\nLook at the figures below. The figure at the left is shaped like the letter L. The rest of the figures are like it, except that they have been turned (rotated) in different directions.
Please press \"Next\" to continue.

If you think of the figure at the left above as being made out of wire and lying on a table, the positions shown in each of the other four figures could be made simply by turning (rotating) the wire figure at the left around, without lifting it off the table. \n\nPlease press \"Next\" to continue.

Now look at the next row of figures. The first figure is shaped like the letter P. But for the rest of the figures, even if they were turned (rotated), they would still be backwards; you would have to lift the figure at the left off the table and flip it over to make any of the other figures.

In this task each question has one figure at the left and five similar figures to the right of it. Only one of the five figures on the right exactly matches the figure at the left if you turn (rotate) it. The rest of the figures are backwards even when they are turned (rotated).

Now look at the sample question below.
Choose the one figure, which, when turned (rotated), exactly matches the figure at the left.
You should have picked the fourth answer choice. All of the other choices have been \"lifted off the table and flipped over\" as well as turned (rotated), and thus are backwards.
For each question in this task, choose the one figure, which, when turned (rotated), exactly matches the figure at the left.\n\nIf you are ready to begin, please press \"Next.\"
Choose the one figure, which, when turned (rotated), exactly matches the figure at the left.

Reaction Time
Reaction Practice

You may now exit by tapping on the SPACEBAR
SPACEBAR
Thank you for completing the test.
You can now exit by tapping on the exit button below.
Exit
You may now exit by tapping on the exit button below.

Now you will practice.

Focus on the cross, and press the SPACEBAR button each time you see the red circle.

Please press the SPACEBAR button when you are ready to begin

This task measures your speed. You will be shown a black cross (+) for a few seconds, followed by a red circle (). Then the cross will appear again, followed by the circle, and so on.

 Your task is to:
 (1) hold your finger over the SPACEBAR button.
 (2) focus on the cross
 (3) each time you see the red circle press the SPACEBAR as quickly as you can

 Press the SPACEBAR button now.
You will see each picture for 5 seconds. Make use of the time and study each picture carefully, for the full 5 seconds.\n\nPlease press \"Next\" when you are ready to begin.
Now click on the picture you have seen.
Please press \"Next\" to go to the next task.

The next task measures your memory. You will see a series of pictures for 5 seconds each. You will then see the original picture along with several similar pictures. Your task is to pick which of the pictures is the one you saw previously.\n\nFor example, you will see a picture like this …
Press on the picture you have studied, then press \"Next\".
Now click on the picture you have seen.

Then later you will see the first picture along with several similar pictures, like these. Your task is to press the picture which is the same as the one you saw previously. In this example, you would press the third picture.
Now, click on the picture you have studied.
Thurstone Example
Thank you for completing the test.
Thurstone

Now that you have practiced, it is time to begin the task.
The procedure is the same as before, but there are more items. You will see each picture for 5 seconds.
Use the time to study each picture carefully.

When you are ready, press "Begin".
Here are some pictures to study.

Now that you have practiced, it is time to begin the task.

The procedure is the same as before, but there are more items. You will see a cross, followed by a red circle. Each time you see the red circle, press the SPACEBAR as quickly as you can.

When you are ready, press the SPACEBAR button.
